column4: my usb wireless dongle is detected and using the ndiswrapper windows drivers, but its not listing in my iwconfig\
linux has no good wireless support
my usb wireless dongle is detected and using the ndiswrapper windows drivers, but its not listing in my iwconfig\
what wireless adapter is it?
don't be too harsh. Wireless support is great in Linux but it's the vendors that decide not to support Linux.
maybe you find an open source driver for the hardware of your's. But it's hard to give support if there is only the windows driver and I don't think they are guaranteed to work.
every brand of network card that is wireless dont work without jacking with it to get it to work.  i work at a computer store where we install ubuntu on computers that come in.
my ipw2200 works out of the box. My Belkin USB dongle works out of the box.
because you knew it would work with linux first before buying
my customers dont do that
that's the problem, yes. :-S In Linux you can't always assume that the hardware works. But again it's the hardware that does not support Linux.
who do you think makes drivers for linux?  the hardware manufacturers? no.  linux programmers to make linux work with it.
who do you think makes the hardware and knows about it? it's not the linux hackers.
well, apparently unsupported usb wireless dongles are a stomach turner for ppl helping others out in here.  i give up, ill just hardline my pc to my nic.
